results.title: Cold chips
results.creator_credit: Udi Eichler, Laurens Postma and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Take Six”.
A creative collaboration between Laurens C. Postma and gifted actor and one-man show performer Tim Thomas, this light-hearted entertainment is the story of a possible person in the not too distant silicone/micro-processor future. It is a future that gratifies every conceivable wish but fails to meet the basic need for human contact.

results.brief_description: Presents the dangers of hypothermia and demonstrates preventive measures. Covers hypothermia caused by immersion in cold water and exposure to wind and low temperatures.

results.title: Cold-rodders
results.creator_credit: Marc Beaudet, ONF | NFB and Claude Larue
results.brief_description: An amusing view of the machine that has taken the country by winter storm: the snowmobile, revving, raring, ready to go. What the motorboat was to the summer lake, this motorized sled now is to the snow-covered fields. This film shows it all - the pull of this sit-down sport, the eagerness of the trade to keep it booming, the daring rivalry of the racing crowd, and the bemused pleasure of the family outing.

results.title: Colbo Nights
results.brief_description: Football practice, barbequed snags and a couple of beers at the pub. This is Thursday night in Colbinabbin and you can meet local characters such as Slab, Meathead and Stewballs. The atmosphere is one of a close knit community that loves sports, live music and supports each other through good times and bad.

results.title: Coke Bottle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Design Classic Series”.
Drink a bottle of Coke and you participate in the American dream. The words of Stephen Bayly, Director of the Conran Foundation epitomise the global system of Western Capitalism. Alex Samuelson’s bottle design won a competition held by the Coca Cola company in 1915.

results.title: Cohuna celebrates the coronation of QE II
results.brief_description: When Cohuna Higher Elementary School wanted to raise money for a film projector, local resident Tom Olsson decided to help by filming life in the township and surrounding countryside, and then showing the footage in the local Town Hall. His footage has been lovingly compiled by the Cohuna Historical Society and the resulting films give us a special glimpse into rural life in 1950’s Victoria. The school recieved their projector, and Olsson’s films were shown annually as a Christmas treat for many years afterward. This segment documents the QEII Coronation parade in 1952.

results.title: Cognitive processes
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
Why have people always been able to link different elements and ideas into coherent relationships? It is our thoughts, our cognitive processes, that give meaning to everything. In this program, Philip Zimbardo examines the work of cognitive psychologists who study how people take in information, store it, transmit it and manipulate it, that is, exploring how we think and solve problems.

results.title: Cognitive development (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Jordan and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on environmental and maturational factors; and the cognitive, learning or behavioural approach of Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann’s behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.

Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann’s behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.
